reviews.review: Kept me guessing through out!!! Brilliantly done!!!
The woman who played Marta was wonderful.
Refreshingly funny whodunnit... relies on clever writing and acting without sex and violence. Go see it.
Loved the movie! The reveal at the end was a bit convoluted but nonetheless it is one of my favorites ive seen this year!
I wanted to like it better. It seemed predictable and slow-moving, while oftentimes the acting seemed to be phoned in. I did appreciate some of the humor though. To me it was good but not great.
Cast was great!  Excellent acting!  Interesting plot!  My kind of movie..

Knives Out was an actually great movie. A fantastic cast with Ana De Armas and Chris Evans stealing the scenes, a banging sweater, red herrings and doughnut holes. This ain't no prop knife, this blade hits it's mark.

The film brings forth a great balance of humour and social awareness, that leaves you following along eagerly whilst the twists and turns are coordinated perflectly by Rian Johnson.
It was a great movie with a crazy twist

The problem with most modern day "whodunit" mysteries is that most are over the top spoofs that simply pay homage to or flat out mock the genre. Knives Out is a TRUE, genuine murder mystery whodunit that actually takes itself and the genre seriously. It's a comedy, but the comedy runs in tandem with the mystery rather than most modern whodunits which up play the comedy almost as if they're embarrassed to be a whodunit. The film is funny. The film is thrilling. The film is well-written. The film is well acted and well paced. The only issue I had with this is that (NO SPOILERS) the person or persons who did "dun it" felt too obvious to me and I wish they had done more to make it less obvious (for instance SPOILER--> they should have made the culprit a more sympathetic character to sort of get us the audience on their side instead of making them so unlikable and suspicious in the first place) That said, you barely notice this issue because the movie was so much fun leading up to it, so it didn't matter.
